front.title: Source Address Finding (SAF) for IPv6 Translation Mechanisms

abstract.t: There are various recent proposals that would result in IPv6 translation becoming permanent. RFC 3424 discusses UNilateral Self- Address Fixing (UNSAF) mechanisms which are required for applications to work with most translation schemes, points out a number of problems with them, and requires an exit strategy for any UNSAF mechanism. This document discusses an alternative to UNSAF mechanisms should IPv6 translation become permanent.
